As New York City grapples with extreme cold, tragic incidents have surged, including multiple deaths among the homeless and fatal fires, while city officials face scrutiny over housing aid delays and rising tensions surrounding ICE cooperation and public safety measures.

### Risks & Alerts

- More people found dead on NYC streets as temperatures continue to plummet; officials urge caution. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Cold causes cable to fall from elevated subway tracks onto cars below in Cypress Hills, Brooklyn. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Dangerous temperatures and wind chills continue through Saturday; residents advised to stay indoors. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- 2 elderly women killed in fatal fires in Brooklyn and Queens within a 2-hour span; fire safety urged. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikgFBVV95cUxOa0huMnMtbVBfbl9RdWw4U3AwTUNBZ1FwNW9FYmZMaGNPN3pFZWJJb3JVSFQyZkx3YW5lMHNsUjRfUXNLMTZaZmZNX0FuNjZQX05yRVlDMlVzVFY0dmMxZUhrN2U4VWU4Z1lpNlJES2RobzdxVll2QWdvQnVXNFVDVzJMTFoxV1RYNDlOTlItMlB1Zw?oc=5)
